Woman who murdered 12-year-old girl in Paris sentenced to life without parole
subhead: A Paris court handed Dahbia Benkired the country's harshest sentence for the rape, torture and murder of Lola Daviet – a crime that provoked national outrage in France, as the young Algerian woman was under a deportation order.

title: US sends aircraft carrier to Latin America as military campaign escalates against alleged drug trafficking
subhead: Trump said Thursday he did not need a declaration of war from US lawmakers to attack Venezuela or other countries he accuses of involvement in the drug trade, warning that strikes on land are coming. Starting in early September, the US has been targeting vessels, allegedly used to smuggle narcotics, in a series of deadly strikes.

title: The Fondation Cartier unveils its new landmark in central Paris
subhead: The Fondation Cartier for Contemporary Art has moved to Place du Palais-Royal in Paris. Like its previous location on Boulevard Raspail, the new building was designed by architect Jean Nouvel, conceived as an innovative, flexible space that can be configured in countless ways.

title: 'The Louvre's stolen jewels, valuable only for their gemstones, are above all outdated and cumbersome'
subhead: Reactions to the Louvre heist ignore the complex equation museums face: offering generous public access while securing cumbersome objects better suited for a bank vault, explains Le Monde columnist Michel Guerrin.

subhead: On Wednesday, interior minister Laurent Nuñez defended the measure, citing Nicolas Sarkozy's 'status' and 'threats against him.' Prison guard unions decried it as 'security madness' and 'unprecedented humiliation.'
byline: Antoine Albertini,  Grégoire Biseau and  Soren Seelow

title: 'Russian Secrets': How Russia built an Arctic spy network using European equipment
subhead: Hidden behind shell companies, Russia acquired advanced Western technologies to build a secret underwater network designed to protect its nuclear weapons. The incident raises questions about Europe's ability to prevent the export of sensitive technologies to Moscow.

title: Louvre museum director admits jewel heist 'was not inevitable'
subhead: Three days after the spectacular theft of eight French crown jewels, Laurence des Cars appeared before the Sénat's culture committee for nearly three hours.
